title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor when it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: Currently, if a file is already opened in one editor in the workbench, there is no error message displayed when attempting to open the same file in another editor. The file simply does not open in the new editor.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor, the workbench should display a warning message indicating that making changes in multiple editors may cause conflicts and ask if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that the file must be closed in the other editor before opening in a new editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Ensure that there is a file associated with an editor in the Windows file explorer.
2. Double click on any Java file in the file explorer and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
3. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
4. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file opened. Close this window.
5. Go back to the Java Perspective and double click on a Java file.
6. The file will now be opened in the workbench.
7. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
8. Note that nothing happens. An error message or warning message should be displayed indicating that editing the file in multiple editors is not allowed until it is closed in the other editor.
